title: Handbook of research on the education of young children
subject: Enfants -- Développement
Éducation de la première enfance -- Programmes d'études

description: The Handbook of Research on the Education of Young Children is the essential reference on research on early childhood education throughout the world. This singular resource provides a comprehensive overview of important contemporary issues as well as the information necessary to make informed judgments about these issues. The field has changed significantly since the publication of the second edition, and this third edition of the handbook takes care to address the entirety of vital new developments. A valuable tool for all those who work and study in the field?of early child.
contents: Cover; Title; Copyright; Contents; Editorial Advisory Board; Additional Reviewers; Preface; Acknowledgments; 1 Introduction: A Contemporary Researcher's Vade Mecum (Redux); Part I. Early Childhood Education and Child Development; 2 Cognitive Development and the Education of Young Children; 3 Young Children's Peer Relations and Social Competence; 4 The Emotional Basis of Learning and Development in Early Childhood Education; 5 Motor Development in Young Children; 6 The Development of Children's Creativity; Part II. Early Childhood Educational Curriculum and Instruction.

7 Rethinking Language Education in Early Childhood: Sociocultural Perspectives8 Views and Issues in Children's Literature; 9 Early Literacy: Towards a Semiotic approach; 10 The Education of Young Dual-Language Learners: An Overview; 11 Mathematics for Early Childhood Education; 12 Science Education in the Early Years; 13 Techno-Tykes: Digital Technologies in Early Childhood; 14 Social Competence Education in Early Childhood: A Sociocultural Perspective; 15 Repositioning the Visual Arts in Early Childhood Education: Continuing Reconsideration; 16 The Dance of Learning.

17 Musical Childhoods: A Survey of Contemporary Research18 Play in Early Childhood Education; 19 U.S. Early Childhood Multicultural Education; Part III. Foundations of Early Childhood Educational Policy; 20 Childhood Poverty: Implications for School Readiness and Early Childhood Education; 21 Effective Early Childhood Education Programs for Disadvantaged Children: A Systematic Review and Case Studies; 22 Educational Policy in the United States Regarding Bilinguals in Early Childhood Education.

23 Young Children's Understanding of Disabilities: Implications for Attitude Development and Inclusive Education24 Child Care for Young Children; 25 Family Context in Early Childhood: Connecting Beliefs, Practices, and Ecologies; 26 Promising Approaches to Professional Development for Early Childhood Educators; 27 Lifting Preschool Quality: Nurturing Effective Teachers; 28 Early Childhood Education Programs in the Public Schools; 29 Assessing Children's Learning in Early Childhood Education Settings; 30 Evaluating the Quality of Early Childhood Education Programs; List of Contributors; Index.
